Package io.crums.sldg

Interface Table

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileTable, VolatileTable
public interface Table
Storage interface for skip ledger. Note the row indexing here, unlike Ledger, is 0-based.
See Also:
SldgConstants.DIGEST

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int ROW_WIDTH
    The row width of the table is twice the digest hash width.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    long addRows​(java.nio.ByteBuffer rows, long index)
    Appends one or more rows.
    default void close()
    Closes the instance.
    default boolean isEmpty()
    Determines if the instance is empty.
    java.nio.ByteBuffer readRow​(long index)
    Returns a previously appended row at the given index.
    long size()
    Returns the number of rows thus far appended.
    default void trimSize​(long newSize)
    Trims the table to the given newSize.

  • Field Details

    • ROW_WIDTH

      static final int ROW_WIDTH
      The row width of the table is twice the digest hash width. A row contains 2 hashes: one, the hash of the input entry; two, the (precomputed) hash of the entire (abstract) row (the input entry and all the row's hash pointers).

  • Method Details

    • addRows

      long addRows​(java.nio.ByteBuffer rows, long index)
      Appends one or more rows.
      Parameters:
      rows - with non-zero multiple of ROW_WIDTH remaining bytes
      index - the expected first row index (or the current size).
      Returns:
      the new size() of the base table

    • readRow

      java.nio.ByteBuffer readRow​(long index)
      Returns a previously appended row at the given index. Indexes, unlike row numbers are 0-based. The implementation checks the argument is in the valid range.
      Parameters:
      index - ≥ 0 and < size()
      Returns:
      non-null buffer with ROW_WIDTH remaining bytes

    • size

      long size()
      Returns the number of rows thus far appended.
      Returns:
      ≥ 0
      See Also:
      trimSize(long)

    • isEmpty

      default boolean isEmpty()
      Determines if the instance is empty.
      Returns:
      true iff size() == 0

    • close

      default void close()
      Closes the instance.

    • trimSize

      default void trimSize​(long newSize) throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
      Trims the table to the given newSize. Optional operation.
      Parameters:
      newSize - ≥ 1 and ≤ size
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the implementation does not support it.
